Velocity and Acceleration:
Measuring force and motion is part of many Go Forth and Measure projects, and there are a number of sensors you can use for this purpose. The accelerometers available for your use are pictured in Fig. 2 and described in Table 2.

Table 2: List of accelerometers and IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) available in the Instrument Library. All items are in the Accelerometers schedule except the WDSS. Please make sure to use sufficiently high sample rate for impulse experiments, ideally at least 10 points on every acceleration peak.

| Code | Name                                | Specifications                                                                                                                 | Comments                                                                                                                                             |
| ----------- | ------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|  ACC     | Vernier 25-g accelerometer              | Range: ±245 m/s2 (±25g) Accuracy: ±2.45 m/s2 (±0.25g) Resolution: 0.16 m/s2                                                        | Useful for impact studies, one-axis only. Make sure sample rate is high enough for all accelerometer impulse experiments!                                                                                                                              |
|  3D      | Vernier 3-axis accelerometer            | Range: ±49 m/s2 (±5g) Accuracy: ±0.5 m/s2 (±0.05g) Resolution: 0.037 m/s2                                                          | Note that it requires 3 inputs on the interface unit.                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|  LGA     | Vernier low-g accelerometer             | Range: ±50 m/s2 (±5g) Accuracy: ±0.5 m/s2 (±0.05g) Resolution: 0.037 m/s2                                                          |  Essentially 1/3 of the 3-axis accelerometer                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|  WDSS    |  Vernier Wireless Dynamic Sensor System | 3-axis accelerometer (±60 m/s2); low-range force sensor (±50 N, DFS specs); ±200 m altimeter, 1 m sensitivity, 0.5 s response time | Can be used remotely, with data downloaded to computer via Bluetooth. Altimeter has been used to measure elevator height, but need to record reference pressure at a fixed location to compensate for atmospheric changes. In Force & Motion schedule. |
|  70G     | Analog Devices 70G                       | Range: ±70g Sensitivity: 24.2 mV/g Offset (0g output): 2.50±0.5 V                                                                  | ADXL001: Specs for 5V (USB powered) input at left. Delicate instrument, wired to connect to Vernier interface. Need to explicitly tell Logger Pro that it is connected using Choose Sensor-Voltage-Raw Voltage (0-5 V).                          |
|  500G    | Analog Devices 500G                      | Range: ±70g Sensitivity: 3.3 mV/g Offset (0g output): 2.50±0.5 V                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|  IMU-6   | SparkFun MPU- 6050                       | 3-axis Gyro: 250-2000 °/s 3–axis Accelerometer: ±2g - ±16g                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|  IMU-9   |  SparkFun SEN- 10736                    | 3-axis Gyro: 2000 °/s 3–axis Accelerometer: ±2g- ±16g 3-axis digital compass: ±8 gauss range, 1°-2° accuracy                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
Force and Motion:
Measuring force can be accomplished in many different ways; in fact, two figures are required to show you all the possibilities (Figs. 3 and 4). Figure 3 shows larger force sensors, and Fig. 4 shows a scale (which can be connected to a USB port) and two types of small force pads. The force pads, or Force Sensing Resistors (FSR) are discussed in more detail below Fig. 4.

Material Testing: Stress, Strain, Hardne:
You will use Strain Gauges in the Soda Can Lab, and are welcome to check out the required hardware to use them on your Go Forth project. These are suitable when measuring small changes in strain (up to about 1%), in relatively rigid materials such as in a wood or metal.

For measurements involving larger deformations of macroscopic samples (including food such as pasta and gummy worms, as well as traditional wood, metal, plastic, or 3D printed parts) you may use some of the other equipment available to you in the 2.671 Lab as well as in other labs in the department, as listed in Table 5, to perform compression, extension, 3-point bending, hardness, and fatigue tests.

Table 4a: Equipment required to use Strain Gauges. The STRAIN KITS are located in the Force & Motion schedule (not reservable, simply check them out when you come to lab), and the BRIDGE and INA are in the Radiation, Sound, Electrical schedule, and must be reserved in advance.

| Code | Name                                | Specifications                                                                                                                 | Comments                                                                                                                                             |
| ----------- | ------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|  STRAIN KIT INST |  Strain Gauge Installation Kit     | Includes Vishay Instruments CEA-13-240UZ- 120 Student Strain Gauge (max measureable strain of order 1%) and supplies needed to mount the gauge(s) on your apparatus.  |
|  STRAIN KIT TEST |  Strain Gauge Test Kit             | Includes cables needed to connect the strain gauge to the bridge circuit and then to INA, as well as resistors for calibration and screwdriver for bridge zeroing.    |
| BRIDGE           | Bridge Circuit from Soda Can Lab   | Must also check out a STRAIN KIT TEST (and, if not already installed, a STRAIN KIT INST)                                                                              |
|  INA             |  Vernier Instrumentation Amplifier | **Older versions not automatically recognized by Logger Pro ** you must use Experiment-Set up Sensors to tell Logger Pro that an INA is connected to the interface_ |

|  30V            |  Vernier 30-V Probe                 | Range ±30V Max voltage on any input: ±10V Input impedance 30 kO Resolution: 15 mV                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|  EXT            | Vernier Analog Extension Cable      |                                                                                                                                                                                    | Use to extend the length of cable between the interface and a sensor                                                                                                                                                  |
|  EXTECH LCR     |  Extech 380193 LCR Meter            | Full scale ranges: Inductance: 2000 µH to 10000H Capacitance: 2000pF to 10 mF Resistance: 20O to 10MO Q: 0 to 9999; Test Freq 120Hz and 1 kHz                                      |  Sensitive measurements of R, C, and L                                                                                                                                                                                |
|  INA            |  Vernier Instrumentation Amplifier  | Gain settings: 150, 75, 7.5, 15, 3, and 1.5±5% Linearity: 1% Frequency response: 0-10kHz Impedance: 1 MO to ground Logger Pro divides by gain to display input, not amplified, V | Extremely useful with sensors such as EEG, Strain Gauges, etc. **Not automatically recognized by Logger Pro – **you must use Experiment-Set up Sensors to tell Logger Pro that an INA is connected to the interface |
|  MSR            | Magnetic Strip Reader/Writer MSR605 |                                                                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| POWER AMP       | Vernier Power Amplifier             | DC to 15 kHz Max input ±12V 10x gain                                                                                                                                               | Check out a function generator from the MITLab to drive the power amplifier                                                                                                                                           |
|  PAAS           |  Vernier Speaker Accessory          | 5 ¼ inch shielded woofer, 30 W max, 8 Ω impedance, 5.8 Ω DC resistance                                                                                                             | Connects to Power Amplifier, useful for applying vibration to test system (has screw thread and hook)                                                                                                                 |

Small and flexible form factor                                                                     |
